product_description: HANDTUFTED RUG - Wool Blend - Cut & Loop pile // Color: Beige Neutral pile height variance
recyclable_offcuts_description: OFFCUTS CAN BE REUSED FOR SAMPLING AND OR CAR MATS OR MATS
compostable_conditions: PLEASE NOTE AS  HAND MADE PRODUCT CONSISTING 100% OF WOOLEN YARN ALOT OF THE QUESTIONS REGARDING DECONSTRUCTED -RECYCLE-TAKEBACK AND REUSE ARE N/S THE RUGS CAN BE CLEANED AND REUSED IN A SECOND HAND MARKET - FREELAY RUGS.ASA NATURAL FIBRE PER THE NZ WOOL AUTHORITY WOOL IS A BIODEGRADABLE FIBRE THAT CAN BREAK DOWN AT END OF LIFE.
water_reduction_techniques: DEPENDENT ON WHICH ORIGIN OF MANUFACTURE EITHER RECYCLED WATER OR HARVESTED RAIN WATER IS USED. PRODUCT IS MANUFACTURED BY HAND- NOT MACHINE MADE
minimisation_design_strategy: YARN FOR THE PROJECT IS NOT TAKEN FROM A PREDYED STOCK PILE OF YARN .THE ONLY YARN DYED OR USED IN THE MANUFACTURE IS THE EXACT AMOUNT FOR THE SPECIFIC SIZE OF THE RUG/S-THE PRODUCT IS MADE TO ORDER TO THE ACTUAL SIZE REQUIREMENT OF THE SPECIFIED AREA OF USE AS SUCH THERE IS NO WASTAGE.
other_comments:
Designer Rugs is dedicated to the improvement of sustainability. We are constantly striving to improve our environmental performance and reduce our impact on the environment.
 
We produce high-quality product, designed to stand the tests of time. Not only are we proud to supply premium product to our clients, but it also reflects our stance on the environmental impact of planned obsolesce – the long lifecycle of our product means reduced waste.  In our rug production, processes are hand controlled to reduce wastage and our carbon footprint.
 
Designer Rugs recognises the importance of renewable materials. Wool forms the major component of our product, which is a naturally renewable and sustainable product. Sheep are part of the natural carbon cycle, consuming the organic carbon stored in plants and converting it to wool. This hard-wearing fibre is also biodegradable at the end of its lifespan.All Wool Fibre [100% Wool] is Carbon Neutral.https://woolsnz.com/sustainability
 
We aim use distribution methods for our product that are environmentally friendly, re-using packaging as much as we can and providing reusable rug bags where possible. We encourage the return and reuse of samples and tufts provided for the product selection process to reduce the impact of sample and tuft production.
 
Internally, our respect for the environment extends to our office policies, where we aim to communicate digitally wherever possible to prevent unnecessary printing. We practice a policy of working without electric lights if they are not required and of ensuring all power is only used when absolutely necessary and we recycle everything we can.
 
We enable specifiers to meet their environmental commitments without compromise aesthetics and quality. Our 100% NZ Wool Products have been tested to the Carpet and Rug Institute Green label Specification (Green Star IEQ-13) for volatile organic compounds (VOCs) and the results indicate the products are low-VOC emitting. Specifying and using these products contributes one credit point under the Green Star Design IEQ-13 credit. 
 
Our environmental and social responsibilities are of paramount importance, and we are committed to the long term aims of sustainable development in all our business activities.
 
Regarding Greenstar [GECA] compliant member document, we do not prescribe to GECA or third party  GREENSTAR membership programs certification that requires the provision of company financial details and profit $ details/turnover to ascertain a point or certification consideration of product.


In accordance with Sustainable practise as custom made rugs specific for the project only the yarn required for the rugs are dyed and manufactured and then handtufted by hand, hence creating a n extensive less footprint than machine made product and/ or yarn bank stored with wastage and negating disposal into land waste of unused yarn. 

Our Sustainability policy can be found on our website on the following links,

https://www.designerrugs.com.au/commercial/materials-and-construction/

https://www.designerrugs.com.au/responsible-manufacturing/

https://www.designerrugs.com.au/designer-rugs-a-30-year-design-legacy-like-no-other/

Regarding our association with Supply Nation, our collaborative indigenous-first nation partner KARI.ORGare a registered Supply Nation Member additional information regarding our existing collaborations and partnerships for over 18 years with Artist Minnie Pwerle and now her family trust and with other first nations artists can be found on the following link, https://www.designerrugs.com.au/indigenous-collections/

recyclable_offcuts_description: Minimal offcuts in the production of our fittings.

reusable_description: Product has been designed to last for decades, this has meant the components of the sign are designed in a way that means different parts can easily be upgraded at end of life.

other_comments: Two major circular benefits of our Environmental Exit Signs are worthy of mention. Firstly, they stay in use longer than electric, battery-reliant exit signs (at least 4 times longer at a minimum of 16 years and a maximum of 30 years compared to 4). Secondly, they require far less valuable abiotic materials to be extracted from the environment, due to there being no requirement for batteries or complicated electrical wiring.

product_name: Carpet Tile With Ecoworx® Backing And Ecosolution Q100™ Fibre
product_code: See Shaw Contract’s website for specific SKU numbers
product_description: PVC-free, Cradle to Cradle Certiﬁed™ carpet tiles optimised for low embodied carbon and recyclable
standard_dimensions: •  610 mm x 610 mm  •  230 mm x 910 mm  •  460 mm x 910 mm  •  300 mm x 1220 mm  •  732 mm x 632 mm  •  711 mm x 635 mm
lead_time: Selected Styles in Stock in Australia
recyclable_percentage_description: 100% Recyclable through our re[TURN] Reclamation Program
recyclable_offcuts_description: The whole of EcoWorx can be recycled back into itself, including any offcuts.
recycled_content_description: 58% (Pre-Consumer 58% | Post-Consumer 0%)
recycling_process_description:
The core component of the Cradle to Cradle design philosophy is circularity. It is not enough to simply say that a product can be recycled - we must demonstrate that the infrastructure to recycle our product actually exists and that it is actively being cycled. Recycling of product must also optimised and increased over time.
This all starts with using the right materials, which is why material health is to critical to our brand.
reusable_description: Yes- carpet tiles can be reused especially if installed with LokDots. LokDots® are a pressure sensitive adhesive for the installation of EcoWorx® carpet tile. This non-toxic and odorless system provides an alternative to wet adhesive, virtually eliminating the issue of VOCs (Volatile Organic Compounds), and providing ease and versatility of installation.
end_of_life_program_description:
Since 2006, we have recycled 450,000,000 kg of post-consumer carpet reducing landfill waste through our re[TURN] Reclamation Program. At the end of its useful life, we will reclaim and recycle EcoWorx® (84 square metres or above at no cost to our customers).

https://www.shawcontract.com/en-au/sustainability/re-turn
water_reduction_techniques: Yes – recycled water is used in our facilities. Stringent Cradle to Cradle certification requirements demand that any water retuned to the environment should be equal or greater in quality than when it was drawn. EcoWorx uses solution-dyed Nylon yarn, which is uses relatively little water usage in manufacturing.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: The most carbon intensive part in the LCA of our products is raw material extraction, representing 60% of the carbon footprint of our EcoWorx® products. If we can get the product back, we bypass the need for new raw material extraction, saving that 60%. Since 2006, we have recycled 450,000,000 kg of post-consumer carpet reducing landfill waste through our re[TURN] Reclamation Program.
minimisation_design_strategy: Our design services team can provide CAD drawings, estimates and product set-out drawings to help the order and waste-minimisation process through accurate quantity selection.
modern_slavery_comments:
Yes – Enterprise-wide modern slavery declaration. In addition, 3rd party Cradle to Cradle certification rigorously investigates modern slavery across entire supply chain.
We are signatories of the UN Global Compact. Principle Four “Labour” states that signatories should uphold the elimination of all forms of forced and compulsory labour.
specific_installation_methods:
re[TURN] shipments must adhere to the re[TURN] Reclamation Staging Guidelines (i.e. dry and free of non-carpet debris)

https://shawfloors.widen.net/view/pdf/w5tzjtvbi1/6.7.23-Updates_reTURN-Reclamation-Staging-Guidelines_soft_surface_v5.pdf?t.download=true&u=pg9hyw
type_of_packaging: EcoWorx is packaged in cardboard cartons which can be readily recycled across all jurisdictions.

product_description: Durra Panel is a truly sustainable compressed straw panel building material with a 100% straw core.

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

recyclable_percentage_description: Durra Panel is 100% biodegradable and can be shredded and used as compost at the end of its useful life.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Durra Panel is 100% biodegradable and can be shredded and used as compost at the end of its useful life.
recycled_content_description:
Durra Panel is primarily made from reclaimed wheat straw, a by-product of annual harvesting.

Visy kraft liner used is made from 100% recycled materials.
reusable_description: Durra Panel and Durra Steel Sections can be used to create modular wall and ceiling systems which are simple to demount and reuse.
end_of_life_program_description: Durra Panel is 100% biodegradable and can be shredded and used as compost at the end of its useful life.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Durra Panel is supplied direct from manufacturing facility to customer, typically no offsite storage required.
minimisation_design_strategy: Durra Panel can provide made to order lengths which avoid waste both during the manufacturing process and cutting onsite.
factory_finished_description: Product is factory finished, ready for immediate installation after delivery.
specific_installation_methods:
To assist in demounting and biodegrading:
- Dry fixing methods are recommended (screw fixings only).
- Avoid toxic paints/coatings.
- Use low VOCs paints or natural sealants such as beeswax.
applied_finish_required_description:
When installing Durra Panel, it’s important to remember that the building envelope must be weathertight before you begin the installation.

Durra Panel wall and ceiling surfaces must be finished with an undercoat sealer immediately after product installation has been completed.
other_comments:
- Durra Panel is made from one of the world's most wasted resources, straw.
- By purchasing this waste material, local farmers receive a secondary source of income and stubble burning is reduced.
- The manufacturing process uses no resins or binding agents, no water or gas and produces zero toxic waste.
- Durra Panel creates healthy indoor air environments, being 99.9% free from VOCs (biophilia).
- Durra Panel sustainably provides acoustic, thermal and fire resistant benefits within the one product.
- Demountable and reusable or 100% biodegradable at end of life.
type_of_packaging: Standard cardboard and plastic wrap is used to protect the product during transport.

product_description: The SENTINEL is an Electrical Insulation Socket for protection against Electric Shock Drowning
minimisation_design_strategy: There are no offcuts or waste
factory_finished_description: The SENTINEL is hidden in a core drilled hole so the black factory finish isnt relevant and even the flange being the only part seen after installation is hidden by a coverplate from the product being grouted into the SENTINEL.
other_comments:
The SENTINEL Electrical Insulation Socket is the Game-Changer in Pool Safety and Compliance and was designed to reduce the need for Equipotential Bonding when installing Pool Fence Spigots, Posts, etc. within 1.25m of the pool or spa edge. Other alternatives to Equipotential Bonding FAIL due to simple wear and tear, exposure to UV radiation, other harsh weather conditions and/or chemical process. One example are puported non conductive spigots that will be conductive if the grub screw caps are left out during installation, fall out at any other time or degrade for the same reasons already mentioned. These spigots will also be conductive if they are chipped, scratched or the coating degrades for the reasons already mentioned.

The SENTINEL is the safer, superior, economical, time saving and inclusive alternative to Equipotential Bonding of extraneous conductive elements.
type_of_packaging: At present the SENTINEL is distributed in recycable cardboard boxes.

end_of_life_program_description:
We aim to enhance the life cycle of Reddie furniture and reduce waste through sustainable measures via reuse, refurbishment or recycling. Where possible, we will take back furniture sold by Reddie to reuse or find alternatives to sending products to landfill. Options include: 

(i) Refurbishment of furniture for possible reuse by the existing customer. 
(ii) On-selling or donation of furniture in it's existing condition to other commercial businesses or organisations. 
(iii) Disassembly of furniture for components/materials reuse or recycling.

Our Product Stewardship initiatives will continue to evolve as we look to provide cost effective solutions that are environmentally beneficial and economically viable.

end_of_life_program_description:
Products reach the end of their product life cycle for a number of
reasons. Decor Systems recognises that end-of-life milestones are
often key to maintaining environmental sustainability initiatives. With
that in mind, we have set out below our End of Product Lifecycle
Policy which aims to dually maintain the ongoing sustainability of our
products and simultaneously support school facilities in areas that
are designated in lower socio-economic regions. In the event that our
acoustic panel systems attain their end of life due to building
demolition or refurbishment, Decor Systems commits to donating
usable panels to educational facilities (schools, training centres,
childcare, etc.) in regions that are identified as having a high
proportion of students with learning challenges. Special consideration
is given to centres that focus on literacy programs for Indigenous
students. The following conditions apply: Liaise with Decor Systems to
determine suitability before panels are returned. Photos will be
required both before and after dismantling to ascertain suitability.
Panels to be dismantled and returned to Decor Systems at the client’s
cost. Panels must be in reasonable condition in their original
manufactured sizes. The final decision will rest with Decor Systems as
to the suitability of the panels for re-deployment to alternative
projects.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Routes are calculated on shortest distance
minimisation_design_strategy:
Vogl is fully perforated end to end, this means that there is less
wastage when cut to size.
modern_slavery_comments:
Decor Systems is committed to ethical business practices and the
eradication of modern slavery in all its forms. We firmly believe in upholding human rights, promoting social responsibility, and maintaining transparency in our operations and supply chains. This Modern Slavery Statement outlines our approach to combating
modern slavery and human trafficking, the steps we have taken to prevent its occurrence, and our plans for continuous improvement.

INTRODUCTION 
This is the second Modern Slavery Statement
submitted by Decor Systems. Decor Systems has elected to publish this statement voluntarily, as informed by the Modern Slavery Act 2018. The purpose of this statement is to outline the business’
systems for identifying the risk of modern slavery in our operations and supply chain and implementing processes to minimise any risk.
Decor Systems recognise that slavery and human trafficking can occur in many forms including forced labour, child labour, human
trafficking, forced marriage and deceptive methods of recruiting labour. Decor Systems are committed to operating responsibly and maintaining ethical standards across our operations, with a particular
focus on risk areas within our supply chain. 

STRUCTURE 
Decor Systems is a family owned Australian owned and operated vertically integrated manufacturer, supplier and retailer of architectural acoustic panel systems. Our headquarters, manufacturing and supply
facility located in Glendenning, NSW. Decor Systems maintains offices in Brisbane and Melbourne. 
OPERATIONS AND SUPPLY CHAINS 
DecorSystems is committed to the superior design, production and supply of quality products and services. We have been in the business for
over 50 years and offer an extensive range of innovative products,
professional services, experience, and industry knowledge. With a growing team of Sales and Project Consultants located throughout
Australia, , a modern manufacturing and supply facility and an international sourcing team, Decor Systems has a valued reputation for reliably delivering state-of-the-art architectural solutions. Decor
Systems’ supply chain includes both local and overseas suppliers with whom the business has established, long-standing supply
agreements in place. Our manufacturing facility produces custom and
made-to-order products, sourcing raw materials and componentry from tier one suppliers mostly located in Australia. Our importing division sources and assembles materials that requires little or no
customisation, with raw materials sourced largely from suppliers located in Germany, USA and Latvia, as well as some local Australian
suppliers. 

ADDRESSING THE RISK OF MODERN SLAVERY PRACTICES

The Decor Systems executive team are committed to ethical
procurement and oppose slavery in all its forms. Policies and risk
management processes have been implemented to identify and
address the risk of modern slavery in our supply chain. This includes
routine supplier evaluation and supply chain mapping that
encompasses a range of environmental and ethical risks, including
modern slavery. Within this supply chain analysis, BFX has identified
two areas of risk. First, a generally low risk of modern slavery in the
construction supplies sector. Second, some second-tier suppliers
where materials are imported from overseas have a medium
geographic and entity risk. 
DUE DILIGENCE AND REMEDIATION
PROCESSES 
To date, Decor Systems has had no reported incidents of
modern slavery or breaches by its overseas suppliers. Nevertheless,
Decor Systems recognises the inherent risk of slavery and human
trafficking within the supply chain and has established internal
processes to guide supplier selection and tendering, including:
Consideration of certain factors before a supplier is awarded a supply
contract. For example, the potential supplier’s reputation, ability to
supply, integrity, financial strength and compliance with legislation
and best practice. Ensuring that Decor Systems do not purchase
materials from suppliers that breach the UN Guiding Principles. If any
existing suppliers are found to have breached the UN Guiding
Principles, Decor Systems will take immediate steps to reassess those
supply arrangements. Staff training within Decor Systems direct
supply chain,in which supplier evaluation is conducted prior to
engagement of suppliers. Existing suppliers are audited in line with
Decor Systems GECA, FSC and Illegal Logging Audit requirements.
FUTURE COMMITMENTS 

Over the next year, Decor Systems focus
areas will be: Further refining our procurement processes and
training our procurement team with best practice initiatives.
Reviewing identified risk areas in the supply chain and reporting to
the Decor Systems board. David Faulkes Chief Executive Officer

other_comments:
Human Health and Safety
HydroSTON pavers help create safer living environments by reducing surface water buildup, which can lead to hazardous conditions like slips and falls. Their permeability also minimises the risk of flooding, contributing to a safer and more resilient community infrastructure. By preventing the accumulation of standing water, these pavers help reduce the breeding grounds for mosquitoes, contributing to better public health outcomes.

Climate Resilience
One of the key climate-related benefits of HydroSTON pavers is their ability to mitigate the urban heat island effect. By allowing water to permeate through the surface and into the ground, these pavers help cool the surrounding environment, which is particularly important in densely built urban areas. This cooling effect not only enhances comfort for residents but also reduces the demand for air conditioning, lowering energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions.

Social Equity
HydroCon is committed to promoting social equity by ensuring that their products are accessible and beneficial to all communities. The company focuses on sourcing materials responsibly and working with local suppliers to support regional economies. By integrating HydroSTON pavers into public spaces, municipalities can create more inclusive environments that are both functional and aesthetically pleasing, benefiting a diverse range of people.

Circularity and Sustainable Materials
HydroSTON pavers are designed with circularity in mind. They are made from high-quality materials. The production process aims to minimise the carbon footprint. Furthermore, at the end of their lifecycle, these pavers can be recycled or repurposed, supporting a circular economy and reducing the environmental impact of construction projects.

The best solution is to provide our clients with legitimate options to dispose of our fabric through the emerging recycling channels now becoming available. By providing our customers with information, we hope it will spark the initiative to close the loop. We are excited to promote UPPAREL as a source for our clients to recycle their offcut fabric from production as well as end of life fabric from dismantled furniture.

Post-consumer material, weight % is approximately 29%.

recycling_process_description: All the materials at the end of their life cycle do not require treatments since, by virtue of the high chemical inertia, do not release substances into the environment. They can be used as fill material for construction sites and as background material for road beds, thus reducing the need for quarried gravel.

product_description: Sustainable Classics: 100% Eco-Polyester, Heavy Duty Commercial, GECA Certified & Carbon Neutral
recyclable_percentage_description: Any fabric not fit for re-spinning including fabric attached to other elements such as glue will be shredded for use in upcycled products such roof tiles, insulation, office partitions and stuffing for pet beds.
recycling_process_description: Depending on the fabric and its condition, the fabrics will be recycled differently. Untarnished fabrics can be blended with virgin fibres to produce yarns ideal for manufacturing new fabrics.
end_of_life_program_description: The responsibility of disposing of used fabrics environmentally is up to our customers. The best solution is to provide our clients with legitimate options to dispose of our fabric through the emerging recycling channels now becoming available. By providing our customers with information, we hope it will spark the initiative to close the loop. We are excited to promote UPPAREL as a source for our clients to recycle their offcut fabric from production as well as end of life fabric from dismantled furniture.
water_reduction_techniques: Manufacturing facilities use a mix of harvested rainwater, mains and recirculated water.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: ASSOCIATED EMISSIONS ARE CALCULATED AND CARBON OFFSET TO RENEWABLE FUEL PROJECTS
minimisation_design_strategy: ALL CONSULT WITH YOUR FURNITURE MANUFACTURER OR UPHOLSTERER AS THEY WILL BE ABLE TO GIVE YOU THE BEST ESTIMATE FOR YOR USAGE
factory_finished_description: NO
other_comments: Sustainable Classics is woven using 100% Eco-Polyester. It is a crepe weave in a solid colour, available in 48 different colourways. This designer fabric is rated Heavy Duty Commercial, it is made in Australia, is GECA certified and is certified Carbon Neutral. It is suitable for all upholstery applications.
type_of_packaging: SLF USE LOW FLAT TUBE PACKAGING WHICH IS NON HALOGENATED PLASTIC.  WE REUSE PLASTIC THAT COMES ON THE ROLLS FROM OUR FABRIC MILLS. WE TAKE BACK CARDBOARD TUBES FROM OUR CUSTOMERS.

end_of_life_program_description: The responsibility of disposing of used fabrics environmentally is up to our customers. The best solution is to provide our clients with legitimate options to dispose of our fabric through the emerging recycling channels now becoming available. By providing our customers with information, we hope it will spark the initiative to close the loop. We are excited to promote UPPAREL as a source for our clients to recycle their offcut fabric from production as well as end of life fabric from dismantled furniture.
water_reduction_techniques: Manufacturing facilities use a mix of harvested rainwater, mains and recirculated water.

By providing our customers with information, we hope it will spark the initiative to close the loop. We are excited to promote UPPAREL as a source for our clients to recycle their offcut fabric from production as well as end of life fabric from dismantled furniture.
water_reduction_techniques: Manufacturing facilities use a mix of harvested rainwater, mains and recirculated water.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: ASSOCIATED EMISSIONS ARE CALCULATED AND CARBON OFFSET TO RENEWABLE FUEL PROJECTS
minimisation_design_strategy: ALL CONSULT WITH YOUR FURNITURE MANUFACTURER OR UPHOLSTERER AS THEY WILL BE ABLE TO GIVE YOU THE BEST ESTIMATE FOR YOR USAGE
factory_finished_description: NO
other_comments: Sustainable Plaad is woven using 100% Australian Wool. It is a square weave with multi colour yarns, available in 4 colourways. This designer fabric is rated Heavy Duty Commercial, it is made in Australia, is GECA certified and is certified Carbon Neutral. It is suitable for all upholstery applications.
type_of_packaging: SLF USE LOW FLAT TUBE PACKAGING WHICH IS NON HALOGENATED PLASTIC.  WE REUSE PLASTIC THAT COMES ON THE ROLLS FROM OUR FABRIC MILLS. WE TAKE BACK CARDBOARD TUBES FROM OUR CUSTOMERS.

product_description: A discrete, high-performance acoustic treatment engineered to absorb high levels of sound energy.

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

standard_dimensions: Thickness 25 mm | 50 mm | 75 mm | 100 mm. Size 1200 mm x 2400 mm | 1200 mm x 2700 mm Custom sizes available up to 3600mm
recyclable_percentage_description: Mechanically mounted products can be reused as they are. Autex has developed bespoke recycling machinery to reprocess uncontaminated waste back into reusable rPET raw material.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Clean uncontaminated off cuts can be repurposed. Autex has developed bespoke recycling machinery to reprocess uncontaminated waste back into reusable rPET raw material.
recycling_process_description: Mechanically mounted products can be reused as they are. Autex has developed bespoke recycling machinery to reprocess uncontaminated waste back into reusable rPET raw material.
water_reduction_techniques: We have dry manufacturing facilities. Waste water is not generated in the manufacturing of our products.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Freight emissions are accounted and fully offset annually. Airfreight is avoided wherever possible. Packaging is fully consolidated and stock managed to reduce freighting TKM.
minimisation_design_strategy: Product is manufactured to standard construction sizes or made to order to suit specific lengths from 1.2m - 3.6m helping the reduction of wastage onsite, packaging and transportation loads.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Potential to degrade into micro-plastics when landfilled or incorrectly disposed of in the environment.
factory_finished_description: Available in 3 Nude Finish's ( white grey and black  or with any Vertiface colour option factory applied.
specific_installation_methods: When specified and installed using Autex proprietary concealed spin fix clips or other mechanical fixings product can be recycled. Adhesive fixing may limit reuse and recycling options.
type_of_packaging: Product is typically supplied in locally made recyclable cardboard packaging,  products may be supplied on reusable-returnable pallets if required.

product_description: An almost feminine legendary stone, vibrating with a delicate, timeless elegance

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

price_adjustment_structure: Price based on m2 purchased, starting from $170/m2 inc. GST (1200x2800x6mm), $150/m2 inc. GST (600x1200mm)
lead_time: Usually available immediately on site at Smithfield
recyclable_percentage_description: Available through third party recycling facilities
recyclable_offcuts_description: They can be crushed and used as concrete aggregates or road construction.
recycled_content_description: Pre-consumer recycled materials is approximately 30%.
recycling_process_description: After demolition and deconstruction, ceramic tiles can be crushed and used in a wide range of different applications, such as concrete aggregates or road construction.
water_reduction_techniques: Yes - there are no water discharges resulting from the manufacturing process of the products since the water used in plant washing and squaring processes is totally recycled internally in the process, both in the preparation phase of the mixture and for the production of atomized, and only to a small extent delivered externally for recovery to authorized parties, in the form of ceramic sludge and unpurified water.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: The mineral raw materials used (clay, sand, feldspar) come directly from their places of origin (quarries or production sites) and arrive via ship and road transport. No extra detours are taken.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts or wastage, it is recommended to consider the layout, design and size of the tile
modern_slavery_comments: Italcer Group guarantees the protection of human rights throughout the value chain.
installation_risks_description: Silica is a naturally occurring mineral found in many types of rock and soil, and therefore  is found in many construction materials including tiles.  Please contact us for more information.
factory_finished_description: Lappato finish, also available in Avorio.

manufacturing_locations.location_name: Reggio Emilia, Province of Reggio Emilia, Italy

other_comments: Our mission is to drive change in our industry by making a conscious effort to shift the way in which we source and procure products.

product_description: Natural stone-effect porcelain stoneware that captures and diffuses light

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

price_adjustment_structure: Price based on m2 purchased, starting from $91/m2 inc. GST
lead_time: Usually available immediately on site at Smithfield
recyclable_percentage_description: Available through third party recycling facilities
recyclable_offcuts_description: They can be crushed and used as concrete aggregates or road construction.
recycled_content_description: Pre-consumer recycled material is >30%.
recycling_process_description: After demolition and deconstruction, ceramic tiles can be crushed and used in a wide range of different applications, such as concrete aggregates or road construction.
water_reduction_techniques: Yes, industrial waste water is 100% recycled within the production cycle.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: All sites are in a nearby location, and the vehicle fleet used is as efficient as possible.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts or wastage, it is recommended to consider the layout, design and size of the tile
installation_risks_description: Silica is a naturally occurring mineral found in many types of rock and soil, and therefore  is found in many construction materials including tiles.  Please contact us for more information.
factory_finished_description:
Polished finish, also available in a matt finish.

Other colours available include gold, grey and blue.

manufacturing_locations.location_name: Reggio Emilia, Province of Reggio Emilia, Italy

other_comments: Our mission is to drive change in our industry by making a conscious effort to shift the way in which we source and procure products.
type_of_packaging: Tiles are packed in cardboard boxes, wrapped with polyethylene film and plastic straps, and stacked on wooden pallets. The amount of packaging material can vary according to the tile size.

recycled_content_description: Pre-consumer recycled materials is approximately 30%.
recycling_process_description: After demolition and deconstruction, ceramic tiles can be crushed and used in a wide range of different applications, such as concrete aggregates or road construction.
water_reduction_techniques: Yes - there are no water discharges resulting from the manufacturing process of the products since the water used in plant washing and squaring processes is totally recycled internally in the process, both in the preparation phase of the mixture and for the production of atomized, and only to a small extent delivered externally for recovery to authorized parties, in the form of ceramic sludge and unpurified water.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: The mineral raw materials used (clay, sand, feldspar) come directly from their places of origin (quarries or production sites) and arrive via ship and road transport. No extra detours are taken.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts or wastage, it is recommended to consider the layout, design and size of the tile

product_name: Sydney Matte White Stone Look Tile
product_description: 9mm rectified Porcelain tile with Matte finish. Dimensions: 300x600 or 600x600mm. Slip Rating: P3.
price_adjustment_structure: Priced based on quantity purchased, starting from $70/m2 RRP inc. GST
recyclable_percentage_description:
Why are porcelain tiles recyclable? 
They are made from inorganic materials.
They can be recycled without chemicals.
They are durable and have consistent performance over time.
There are many recycling companies in Australia that accept tile waste. Some companies specialise in removing and disposing of tile waste.
recyclable_offcuts_description:
Tile offcuts can be recycled or upcycled in various practical and creative ways:
Crushed and repurposed as road base, aggregate, or landscaping materials.
Broken into smaller pieces and used in construction projects, such as making concrete and building materials.
Garden and Landscaping
Furniture Accents
Decorative mosaics or art Installations
recycling_process_description: Porcelain tiles are crushed into different aggregate sizes and used as a raw material to make new tiles or as a road base.
water_reduction_techniques: Recycled water or on-site harvested rainwater where possible.
minimisation_design_strategy:
Reducing wastage during tile installation is a combination of careful planning, proper techniques, and efficient use of materials. Here are some practical tips:

1. Plan Ahead
Measure Accurately: Measure the area carefully to calculate the exact number of tiles needed, including cuts and potential wastage.
Purchase Extra Strategically: Buy about 10-15% more tiles than calculated to account for breakage, cuts, or future repairs—but avoid overbuying.
Choose the Right Tile Sizes: Opt for tile sizes that fit your space well to minimize cutting and waste.
2. Optimize Layout
Dry Lay the Tiles: Lay out the tiles on the floor or wall before fixing them to identify the best layout and minimize cuts.
Start from the Center: Begin tiling from the center of the room or focal point to ensure symmetrical cuts at the edges.
Plan Cuts Strategically: Place cut tiles in less noticeable areas, such as corners or under furniture.
3. Use Precision Cutting Tools
Invest in quality tools like a tile cutter or wet saw to make accurate cuts and reduce breakage.
Practice cutting on scrap tiles to avoid mistakes.
4. Handle Tiles Properly
Avoid rough handling to prevent breakage during transportation and installation.
Store tiles on a flat surface in a safe area to reduce the risk of chipping or cracking.
5. Minimize Breakage
Use the correct adhesive and follow the manufacturer’s instructions to ensure tiles stick securely without cracking.
Avoid dropping heavy tools or materials on the tiles during installation.
6. Recycle and Reuse
Save usable offcuts for future projects or repairs.
Repurpose broken tiles for mosaics or as fillers in other areas.
7. Hire Professionals (if necessary)
Experienced tile installers can reduce wastage significantly through proper techniques and efficient planning.
modern_slavery_comments: Regular visits to all factories to ensure proper working conditions are adhered to.
installation_risks_description: Silica is a naturally occurring mineral found in many types of rock and soil, and is found in many construction materials including tiles. To mitigate silica risk when working with porcelain tiles, installers should comply with industry recommended safety measures. Please contact us for more information.
factory_finished_description: Matte Porcelain.
type_of_packaging: Recyclable cardboard boxes

Choose the Right Tile Sizes: Opt for tile sizes that fit your space well to minimize cutting and waste.
2. Optimize Layout
Dry Lay the Tiles: Lay out the tiles on the floor or wall before fixing them to identify the best layout and minimize cuts.
Start from the Center: Begin tiling from the center of the room or focal point to ensure symmetrical cuts at the edges.
Plan Cuts Strategically: Place cut tiles in less noticeable areas, such as corners or under furniture.
3. Use Precision Cutting Tools
Invest in quality tools like a tile cutter or wet saw to make accurate cuts and reduce breakage.
Practice cutting on scrap tiles to avoid mistakes.
4. Handle Tiles Properly
Avoid rough handling to prevent breakage during transportation and installation.
Store tiles on a flat surface in a safe area to reduce the risk of chipping or cracking.
5. Minimize Breakage
Use the correct adhesive and follow the manufacturer’s instructions to ensure tiles stick securely without cracking.
Avoid dropping heavy tools or materials on the tiles during installation.
6. Recycle and Reuse
Save usable offcuts for future projects or repairs.
Repurpose broken tiles for mosaics or as fillers in other areas.
7. Hire Professionals (if necessary)
Experienced tile installers can reduce wastage significantly through proper techniques and efficient planning.
modern_slavery_comments: Regular visits to all factories to ensure proper working conditions are adhered to.

product_description: Surface Avorio is a versatile porcelain tile designed for both floors and walls.
recyclable_percentage_description: Some porcelain tiles are designed for onshore recycling, where they can be crushed and repurposed into new tiles, road base, or other construction materials.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Yes, porcelain tile offcuts can be recycled into new tiles, crushed for road base or aggregate, or upcycled for creative projects like mosaics or furniture surfaces.
recycled_content_description: Porcelain tiles are crushed into various aggregate sizes and repurposed as raw material for new tiles, road bases, or other construction applications. They can also be used in landscaping, drainage systems, and eco-friendly concrete production, reducing landfill waste and promoting sustainability.
recycling_process_description: Yes, porcelain tiles can be deconstructed and reprocessed into raw materials. Once removed, they can be crushed and used in the production of new tiles, road base, or other construction materials. This process helps reduce landfill waste and supports a circular economy in the building industry.
minimisation_design_strategy:
To minimise offcuts and wastage, consider:

- Tile Sizing & Layout: Choose tile sizes that best fit the space to reduce cuts.
- Grid-Based Design: Align tiles with room dimensions to avoid unnecessary trimming.
- Modular Coordination: Use standardised tile sizes that align with fixtures and joints.
- Precision Cutting: Plan cuts strategically to reuse offcuts in less visible areas.
- Ordering Efficiently: Calculate tile quantities carefully to avoid excess waste.
installation_risks_description: Silica is a naturally occurring mineral present in various rocks, soil, and construction materials, including tiles. To minimise silica exposure when working with porcelain tiles, installers should follow industry-recommended safety measures and wear appropriate PPE. Contact us for more information.
specific_installation_methods: To enable recycling or reuse, mechanical fixing methods (such as clip systems) are preferred over adhesives, as they allow easier tile removal. Avoid strong adhesives and epoxy-based grouts, which make tile recovery difficult. Composting is not applicable.
other_comments: Porcelain tiles are a sustainable choice as they are made from natural materials, free from VOCs (volatile organic compounds), and contribute to healthier indoor air quality. They are highly durable, reducing the need for frequent replacements, and can be recycled at the end of their life cycle.

end_of_life_program_description:
We aim to enhance the life cycle of Reddie furniture and reduce waste through sustainable measures via reuse, refurbishment or recycling. Where possible, we will take back furniture sold by Reddie to reuse or find alternatives to sending products to landfill. Options include: 

(i) Refurbishment of furniture for possible reuse by the existing customer. 
(ii) On-selling or donation of furniture in it's existing condition to other commercial businesses or organisations. 
(iii) Disassembly of furniture for components/materials reuse or recycling.

Our Product Stewardship initiatives will continue to evolve as we look to provide cost effective solutions that are environmentally beneficial and economically viable.
minimisation_design_strategy: Product is made from 100% reclaimed materials, offcuts are used for our furniture accessories.

Our Product Stewardship initiatives will continue to evolve as we look to provide cost effective solutions that are environmentally beneficial and economically viable.

end_of_life_program_description:
We aim to enhance the life cycle of Reddie furniture and reduce waste through sustainable measures via reuse, refurbishment or recycling. Where possible, we will take back furniture sold by Reddie to reuse or find alternatives to sending products to landfill. Options include: 

(i) Refurbishment of furniture for possible reuse by the existing customer. 
(ii) On-selling or donation of furniture in it's existing condition to other commercial businesses or organisations. 
(iii) Disassembly of furniture for components/materials reuse or recycling.

Our Product Stewardship initiatives will continue to evolve as we look to provide cost effective solutions that are environmentally beneficial and economically viable.

recyclable_percentage_description: ResiLoop is a not-for-profit product stewardship scheme that is funded by leading suppliers of the resilient flooring industry, including Shaw Contract. TThrough Resiloop, we enable a circular future for floorcoverings in Australia. ResiLoop's scheme is authorised by the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission
end_of_life_program_description: Shaw Contract are one of the leading suppliers of resilient floorcoverings in our local market that have committed to provide funding support for ResiLoop, Australia’s first national stewardship scheme for resilient flooring.
water_reduction_techniques: In 2024 we used 52% less water per pound of finished product compared to 2010.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Reducing the carbon footprint of our products and operations requires a deep understanding of our entire value chain. In 2023, Shaw began delving further into that value chain by more systematically collecting data that would allow us to measure, report and set goals to reduce our Scope 3 emissions using science-based targets. Scope 3 emissions include those from the production of purchased materials, business travel, employee commuting, transportation and distribution, waste disposal, recycling of materials and products,
minimisation_design_strategy: Our design services team can provide CAD drawings, estimates and product set-out drawings to help the order and waste-minimisation process through accurate quantity selection.
modern_slavery_comments: Yes – Enterprise-wide modern slavery declaration. We are signatories of the UN Global Compact. Principle Four “Labour” states that signatories should uphold the elimination of all forms of forced and compulsory labour.

product_description: A premium high performance fabric for heavy use in commercial interiors and exteriors
lead_time: 1-2 weeks if in stock. 8-10 weeks if not in stock.
recyclable_percentage_description: Willie Weston encourages all customers to recycle fabrics through Upparel, TRAKS or similar textile recycling programs at the end of their life.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Willie Weston encourages all customers to recycle fabrics through Upparel, TRAKS or similar recycling programs at the end of their life.
recycled_content_description: Global Recycled Standard Certificate states 85% of the product is derived from post-consumer PET plastic bottles
water_reduction_techniques: The Italian based manufacturer of our High Performance/Outdoor fabric minimises the use of public potable water supply through a dedicated water well on-site.
minimisation_design_strategy:
Our fabrics are printed to order to reduce over production and wastage.

To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, we appreciate precise measurements and encourage economical pattern design and cutting techniques to maximise fabric usage.

manufacturing_locations.location_name: Milan, Metropolitan City of Milan, Italy

material_locations.location_name: Milan, Metropolitan City of Milan, Italy

other_comments:
High Performance / Outdoor is a premium fabric for high traffic interiors and exteriors. With excellent abrasion resistance and the ability to be bleach cleaned, this fabric is suitable for upholstery applications in educational and hospitality settings, as well as public spaces. Strong UV tolerance and water, chlorine and salt resistance make it perfect for outdoor upholstery and soft furnishings.


Established in Naarm (Melbourne) in 2015 by two non-Indigenous art curators, Willie Weston is the first and only textile brand working exclusively with Australian First Nations artists to create textiles, wallpapers and other products for commercial interiors. Sourcing sophisticated and diverse artworks from First Nations artists across Australia, we delicately translate these works into contemporary designs.
type_of_packaging: Willie Weston are currently exploring options for a biodegradable plastic wrap to package rolls of fabric for distribution. We use a 'Global Green Tag' verified biodegradable plastic tape for all our packaging. We recycle soft plastic packaging that we receive from suppliers and mills through Reground.

product_description: An eco-friendly, sustainable wallpaper base with a lightly textured matte surface
recyclable_percentage_description: The product is PVC-free and can potentially be repurposed through specialised recycling programs, such as those offered by Terracycle; however, actual recycling availability depends on local facilities and programs.
recyclable_offcuts_description: The product is PVC-free and can potentially be repurposed through specialized recycling programs, such as those offered by Terracycle; however, actual recycling availability depends on local facilities and programs.
recycled_content_description: Our Eco Commercial Wallpaper is made with a proprietary blend of polyester and natural fibers. The natural fiber component is FSC certified. It contains 31% Post Consumer Recycled content reclaimed from plastic bottles.
end_of_life_program_description: The product is PVC-free and can potentially be repurposed through specialised recycling programs, such as those offered by Terracycle; however, actual recycling availability depends on local facilities and programs.
water_reduction_techniques: Our manufacturer utilises closed-loop systems for chilling, which do not require the use of fresh water.
minimisation_design_strategy: Our wallpapers are printed to order to reduce over production and wastage.
other_comments:
This eco-friendly wallpaper offers a matte, lightly textured surface and strong non-woven backing, suitable for general workplace, commercial and hospitality environments. Digitally printed in Australia, Eco Commercial Wallpaper is sustainable, PVC Free and breathable, and made from 31% post-consumer recycled content. 
https://www.willieweston.com/
type_of_packaging: We use a 'Global Green Tag' verified biodegradable plastic tape for all our packaging. We recycle soft plastic packaging that we receive from suppliers and mills through Reground.
